;

;;

;

;September 26, 2023, Guangzhou, after the double selection meeting on Jinan University . ;(Ke Yule/Photo);

;

;The lights were all bright in the thousands-square-meter gymnasium, and 28 tables were arranged in a circle. The tabletop is covered with blue velvet, and beside each table stands a promotional poster as tall as one person.

;

;At noon on September 20, 2023, at the Wushan Campus of South China University of Technology in Guangzhou, in half an hour, the special double election meeting for Shenzhen state-owned enterprises will begin. This is the third "double selection meeting" prepared by this 985 university for the 2024 graduates.

;

;The topic of employment for graduates in 2023 is still hot, and the school recruitment season for 2024 has begun again.

;

;Owen Xin, a senior student in our school’s School of Business Administration, has been waiting on the sidelines for a long time. She had done a lot of planning in advance. She was wearing a white T-shirt with a small colorful pattern and the hem was tucked into light-colored suit pants. It was half casual and half formal. On a certain social platform, a state-owned enterprise employee once posted, Different from the stereotype of full-body formal wear, "business casual" is the image of employees favored by state-owned enterprises.

;

;“Specially for state-owned enterprises”, Owen Xin stepped into the venue of the autumn recruitment fair for the first time. She had long made up her mind to take the civil service examination, and the administrative position in a state-owned enterprise, which was the least stable, was regarded as a "guaranteed".

;

;Every fall semester begins, thousands of freshmen enter colleges and universities, and thousands of fresh graduates are about to be sent to the next stop on the train of life. But it is not easy to get off the bus. According to data released by the Ministry of Education, the number of college graduates in 2024 is expected to reach 11.87 million, reaching a new high, an increase of 290,000 from 2023.

;

;Double selection usually means the beginning of the new school recruitment season. This is a traditional recruitment form that directly invites companies to join the school to achieve offline face-to-face communication and two-way selection between companies and job-seeking students. Every step and every person leading to the workplace is surrounded by selection, comparison and competition. As policies, markets, and employment concepts change, the status of academic qualifications, majors, industries, and positions has also changed several times.

;

;In the last 10 days of September 2023, Southern Weekend reporters visited a total of four double selection meetings of varying sizes in three schools in Guangzhou. At the same time, the autumn double elections across the country started almost simultaneously.

;

;;

;

;On September 20, 2023, in Guangzhou, the theme of the South China University of Technology was the double selection meeting for the 2024 campus recruitment of Shenzhen state-owned enterprises. ;(Ke Yule/Picture);

;

;;Enterprises that are in trouble;

;

;"They are not You know, our company is very good.” Wang Ming, the head of human resources at a state-owned real estate company in Shenzhen, complained at the Chinese Workers’ Dual Election Meeting on September 20.

;

;Public information shows that the group was founded in 1989 and went public three years later. It is mainly engaged in real estate development and operations and is directly managed by the Shenzhen Municipal State-owned Assets Supervision Bureau.

;

;This state-owned enterprise is well prepared. Most companies present only sent two personnel, while they sent three. But obviously, the extra manpower was not put to much use.

;

;There were very few inquiries. When he was bored, Wang Ming took two photos. One picture is of another company, with four or five students queuing up in front of the booth, waiting for consultation; the other picture is of their own booth, with two HRs staring blankly in front of no one.

;

;Wang Ming’s group is not the only company that has faced the cold shoulder in this double election. Even if they are state-owned enterprises and some established real estate companies, they have been left out.

;

;Around 2010, the golden age of the real estate industry, they were also a popular unit in the double election. "The real estate industry has been in decline since two or three years ago." HR from one of the companies said frankly, "Many students majoring in civil engineering and architecture have chosen to change industries, and students who intend to find employment in the real estate industry are also more cautious."

;

; "Fortunately, good policies have been introduced." Wang Ming said, taking out his mobile phone and showing the "internal information" he had obtained. The screenshot with black text on a white background mentioned that some districts in Guangzhou will completely cancel property purchase restrictions. .

;

;Soon, the "inside information" was publicly confirmed. On the afternoon of the same day, Guangzhou issued the "Notice of the General Office of the Guangzhou Municipal People's Government on Optimizing Policies for the Stable and Healthy Development of the City's Real Estate Market" - Guangzhou became the first city among the first-tier cities in the country to partially relax purchase restrictions.

;

;For a long time in the past, the three industries of Internet, real estate, and education were known as the “Three Giants of School Recruitment” due to their large number of school recruitment positions and strong talent absorption capabilities. Zhaopin Recruitment Job Demand Data It shows that in 2021, the three giants jointly provided 56% of positions for fresh graduates. In the same year, the situation changed. Due to various reasons, the three giants frequently laid off employees, and the motivation for school recruitment was also insufficient.

;

;If real estate practitioners can still see some opportunities from policy changes, the education and training industry still does not know what the future holds.

;

;HR Deng Wenqing of a well-known education and training institution considers herself to be very "hardworking". Since September, as the company's human resources representative in Guangzhou, she has participated in three double-election meetings. "I was basically the last one to leave." Another double selection meeting on September 26 was originally scheduled to end at 5 p.m. Deng Wenqing sat until 5:30. Whenever a student stopped in front of the booth, she enthusiastically handed over the brochure.

;

;But her diligence cannot eliminate the impact of the education and training reform two years ago. An economics master's student stopped when passing by the booth and asked bluntly: "Is this unrestricted? Does the state not care?"

;

;Deng Wenqing repeated the explanation: "The double reduction is for compulsory education and make-up classes. We only focus on high school subjects in this area, and focus on comprehensive quality training in junior high schools and below, without restrictions."

;

;In another double selection meeting at the same time, it was also necessary to explain to the students that another tutor The HR of training institutions also adopts basically the same statement.

;

;Going back to July 2021, the "double reduction" curtain has begun. In one year, subject-based off-campus training institutions across the country have been reduced by more than 90%, and 25 related listed companies have announced that 100% of them will no longer engage in subject-based training in the compulsory education stage. In the past two years, in order to reduce media exposure, Deng Wenqing's organization has been very low-key in its online recruitment promotions. During the campus recruitment season, HR in various places has turned to offline recruitment.

;

;Few people talk about the past glory of the education and training industry. In 2020, in the first quarter China job market sentiment report jointly launched by the China Employment Research Institute of Renmin University of China and Zhaopin Recruitment, the education and training industry once ranked first, surpassing the Internet and e-commerce. That year, a leading company launched a spring campus recruitment of 3,000 people, and several online education institutions that became famous that year had a total recruitment of nearly 10,000 people.

;

;At the double selection meeting on September 20, Deng Wenqing received a total of 12 resumes, and the master of economics who raised the question finally took away a brochure and promised to go back and read it again.

;

;;

;

;On September 26, 2023, in Guangzhou, at the double selection meeting on the campus of Jinan University, many graduates gathered in front of the booth of a new materials company. ;(Ke Yule/Picture);

;

;;Two-way selection;

;

;Taking Guangzhou as an example, usually Throughout the entire employment season, more than 200 double selection meetings will be held from September to June of the following year.

;

;"Enterprise recruitment is nothing more than online and offline channels. Online, some recruitment information is posted on the employment website or employment official account. Offline is information sessions and this kind of (double selection) Job fair." Xu Yang, the project manager of a school recruitment human resources company in Guangzhou introduced.

;

;This is a human resources service platform focusing on campus recruitment. According to the official website, the platform has reached cooperation with more than 50 universities, hosts more than 200 offline dual selection meetings every year, and has provided services to a total of 206,000 companies. Three of the four double-election meetings visited by Southern Weekend reporters were hosted by this platform.

;

;Usually, a regular double selection meeting is jointly organized by a university and a human resources company. The school provides the venue and student source data, and the human resources company is responsible for connecting with the company, arranging the venue, etc. Xu Yang said that in the offline format, the double selection meeting is more effective than the information session. Dozens to hundreds of companies are present at the same time. "It will be more efficient in solving employment needs, and the school also recognizes the double selection meeting."

;

;As for recruitment efficiency, the most intuitive thing for companies is the on-site consultation situation.

;

;Wu Feng is running for the double election in his second year. He is the person in charge of the Guangzhou branch of a civil service examination training institution. The institution has only been established for three years. The training business covers civil servants, selected students, public institutions, etc., full-time There are less than 20 lecturers, and it can only be considered a small and micro enterprise in terms of scale.

;

;But on the afternoon of September 28, in front of the teaching building of Guangdong University of Foreign Studies, next to Wu Feng’s booth, there were almost no interruptions in the number of students who came to consult. This day is approaching the Mid-Autumn Festival and the National Day holiday, so there are not many students participating in the double selection meeting.

;

;Wu Feng has several copies of "Real Questions for the Written Examination for Selected Students in Guangdong" on his desk. The slogan "Scan the QR code to get it" attracted many students.

;

;“The public examination is more popular now.” Wu Feng knew that his company had taken advantage of the popularity of the public examination and the postgraduate entrance examination. For many fresh graduates who have not thought clearly about their way out, the iron rice bowl is undoubtedly the "certain way out."

;

;However, even if the "public examination" is popular, not every time you participate in the double selection meeting, it will be so smooth. Wu Feng mentioned that in the fall of 2022, he went to Sun Yat-sen University to participate in the double selection meeting, but the results were not satisfactory. "Our company is smaller, and those students may prefer big companies more." This year, the Sun Yat-sen University stop was canceled on his recruiting schedule.

;

;In a longer time dimension, school enrollment retention rate also determines corporate recruitment decisions.

;

;Huang Li, HR of a news website in Foshan, has participated in the double selection meeting for four years. It is planned that this year she will go to Guangzhou University, Guangdong University of Foreign Studies and other universities to recruit, but the journalism and communication major ranks high A well-known university in the province is not among them. The reason lies in the recruitment retention rate.

;

;Huang Li remembers that in the spring recruitment of 2021, her employer recruited four boys in the same dormitory from this university. After a month, "all left."

;

;“Among the four people, some have returned to their hometowns, some have taken the civil service exam, and some have taken the professional education exam.” Huang Li added, “Re-recruitment also requires training, which is time-consuming and costly. I don’t want to recruit students from this university anymore.”

;

;Companies choose schools and are also chosen by schools. "If it is an unknown company with only 10 or 20 people, it will definitely not be accepted. This is irresponsible to the company itself. If they come here, they will not be able to recruit people." Jinan University double selection on the afternoon of September 26 At the meeting, another person in charge of the aforementioned school recruitment platform revealed that the school will have certain requirements for participating companies.

;

;“Take JNU as an example. What it requires must be well-known companies. For example, how many of China’s top 500 companies, how many of the world’s top 500 companies, what is the salary range, and the academic qualifications suitable for the position (is it Bachelor's degree and above), these requirements will be met."

;

;Some double selection sessions will limit the themes and gather certain types of companies into one session. For example, the double selection meeting held at South China University of Technology on September 20 was aimed at Shenzhen state-owned enterprises, and the double selection meeting held at Guangdong University of Technology on September 26 was aimed at the micro-semiconductor industry. On September 27, another dual-selection meeting held by South China University of Technology gathered more than 200 companies, focusing on recruiting high-level talents in education, scientific research, and medical and health fields that are urgently needed and in short supply in key fields in Guangxi.

;

;;

;

;On September 27, 2023, in Guangzhou, the Guangxi-themed double-election meeting on the campus of South China University of Technology carried the slogan "I want to go to Guangxi". ;(Ke Yule/Picture);

;

;;Supply and demand issues;

;

;In order to participate in the event on September 27 For the double selection meeting of South China University of Technology, Li Jiamin, a master's student majoring in materials science at Sun Yat-sen University, specially set out from Shenzhen and took the school bus for nearly two hours to arrive.

;

;Her enthusiasm dropped by half after entering school. Different from the double-election meeting a week ago, this time the venue was outdoors, crowded, noisy and hot, and corporate leaflets scattered everywhere were trampled under people's feet. Soon, she was sitting next to the wall to rest.

;

;Li Jiamin graduated from a college in Shanxi three years ago. She concentrated on preparing for the postgraduate entrance examination and "went a lot of effort" to get into the CUHK. When enrolling as a graduate student, her supervisor told her and her classmates not to go to graduate school just to improve their academic qualifications and find a job. But Li Jiamin was not convinced, "The facts are there. The starting salary of graduate students is higher than that of undergraduate students. Everyone thinks so."

;

;Before participating in this double election meeting, she specifically inquired about industry salaries. Others told her that in Shenzhen, a monthly salary of less than 20,000 yuan for a master's degree in materials science is considered low.

;

;For a long time, every science and engineering student who had no clue when filling out their application form would tacitly memorize the same formula, "Biochemical and environmental materials, four major sinkholes." In the stereotype, they are synonymous with little money, tiring work, and fierce competition. However, under the guidance of policies such as carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, traditional industries are transforming into new materials, new energy, semiconductors, and smart manufacturing. It is not uncommon for fresh graduates to earn an annual salary of 300,000 yuan.

;

;But today's double selection meeting still disappointed her a little. "(The monthly salary offered by the company) is around 15,000 to 17,000, which is much lower than I expected." She brought six resumes, and she had a few left before leaving.

;

;In the four years since he has been engaged in campus recruitment, Xu Yang has observed that the asymmetry between supply and demand for jobs at the double selection meeting has become increasingly prominent. On the one hand, students' enthusiasm for employment continues to increase and the number of participants is rising; on the other hand, the number of participating companies and the number of jobs released is decreasing.

;

;"The needs of enterprises are affected by the general environment. In 2021, more than 100 companies will participate in the double selection meeting we will organize at Guangzhou Foreign Language School, but today there are less than 60." September 28 On the same day, Xu Yang said this at the double election meeting of Guangdong University of Foreign Studies.

;

;In Xu Yang’s view, the asymmetric supply and demand relationship has both good and bad effects on the employment situation. "The good thing is that for companies, there are fewer people to recruit, but there are more students coming. Companies can have more opportunities to select the right people. But it has indeed become harder for students to find jobs."

;

;On the afternoon of September 28, a female student from Guangdong Pharmaceutical University finished her interview with Wu Feng and stopped in front of the booth.

;

;When asked why she was interested in the public examination institution, the girl pulled the Southern Weekend reporter aside and whispered, "You can work part-time and take the public examination at the same time." Then her expression changed again. She was suspicious, "I told you, how can I find a job?"

;

;Her worries may be unnecessary. Wu Feng doesn't mind that the lecturer is preparing for the civil service exam at the same time. On the contrary, he encourages it. In his opinion, "you will get started faster if you have experience in preparing for the exam."

;

;Wu Feng even said that when it comes to the interview stage, he will directly advise job seekers to prepare for the public examination. After the examination, they will determine their initial intentions and final re-examination. But when he said this, he frowned and did not relax.

;

;(Wang Ming, Deng Wenqing, Xu Yang, Wu Feng, Huang Li, and Li Jiamin are pseudonyms)

;

;;;

;On the afternoon of October 16, 2023, parents waited with their children outside the emergency clinic on the first floor of Xinhua Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine. Photo by Southern Weekend reporter Huang Sizhuo

;

;"Sure enough, it's mycoplasma again!" On October 16, 2023, Dr. Ding Guodong from Xinhua Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine, formerly We planned to watch 30 special numbers in the morning, and temporarily added 10 more numbers, which lasted until 1 p.m.

;

;"The doctors in our department are basically full every day, and the inpatient beds are also very tight. Some children may have to wait for several days before they can be admitted." Ding Guodong is the deputy chief physician of the Pediatric Respiratory Department. He and his colleagues have been working at an overloaded pace since mid-September. “At this stage, almost 90% of the hospitalized children in the Pediatric Respiratory Department are infected with Mycoplasma pneumoniae. , and the proportion of drug-resistant mycoplasmas is very high."

;

;Mycoplasma pneumoniae has a diameter of 50-300 nanometers, nearly one thousandth the diameter of a human hair. It is a microorganism between bacteria and viruses. Pneumonia caused by this microorganism is the most common community-acquired pneumonia in children aged 5 and above in China (;refers to infectious diseases suffered outside the hospital Pulmonary parenchymal inflammation;), mostly occurs in autumn and winter.

;

;Since the beginning of the school year in September, not only Shanghai, but also hospitals in Beijing, Hebei, Jiangsu and other places have seen more children with Mycoplasma pneumoniae, and they are younger. characteristics. According to a CCTV News report on October 13, the incidence of respiratory infectious diseases has increased across the country recently, and Mycoplasma pneumoniae has entered the season of high incidence. Children need timely medical treatment and appropriate medication.

;

;"There are 246 people in front of you"

;

;Before four o'clock in the afternoon on October 15, Qin Nannan finally registered his son. At that time, the number of a deputy chief physician at Beijing Children's Hospital had reached No. 556. While waiting for treatment, she discovered that someone had already received more than 800 numbers. Finally, when it was time to collect blood, Qin Nannan got the number 1310. The number strip also thoughtfully marked "There are 246 people in front of you."

;

;Xu Baoping, director of the Respiratory Department of Beijing Children's Hospital, said in an interview with the media on October 13 that since September, the hospital's fever and cough clinic has received a daily volume of 3,000-4,700 patients, 20% of whom tested positive for mycoplasma antibodies.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters found that the hospital specially posted a notice on a wall, "The number of children undergoing treatment has increased significantly recently, and the hospital has deployed all medical staff in the hospital to continuously We are working overtime to support the clinic and are doing our best to ensure the medical needs of children. Please understand and wait patiently."

;

;"Beijing Children's Hospital has opened a dedicated fever and cough clinic. It was built a bit like a shelter, and the general outpatient clinic on the other side was just as crowded. We had to wait for nearly two and a half hours just for blood tests that day," Qin Nannan said.

;

;There is also a long queue at Xinhua Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine. On the evening of October 16, near the end of the day, the emergency department on the first floor and the pediatric internal medicine clinic on the second floor of the hospital were crowded with parents and children coming to see the doctor. Those who could not find an empty seat could only sit on the floor in the corridor to rest temporarily. . The temperature in Shanghai on this day was only about 20 degrees Celsius, but many people's hair had already been soaked with sweat.

;

;The pediatric department of Xinhua Hospital is well-known throughout the country. There are many people coming to see the doctor from other places, and there are also some patients who are referred to the hospital because they cannot be treated by the grassroots hospital. Ding Guodong lamented to Southern Weekend reporters that recently all the medical staff in the hospital go to the outpatient and emergency departments to provide support whenever they are free during the day. Many doctors stay at night to work overtime, visit the outpatient and emergency departments or admit children to the hospital. "There are just too many patients."

;

;;

;

;On the evening of October 12, 2023, the infusion center of Beijing Children's Hospital Affiliated to Capital Medical University was filled with children suffering from diarrhea and accompanying parents, and coughs could be heard one after another. Photo by Xi Lijie, Southern Weekend intern

;

;;“Drug resistance has been around for many years”;

;

;Different from general bacterial pneumonia, since Mycoplasma pneumoniae does not have a cell wall, the penicillins and cephalosporins familiar to ordinary families are completely ineffective against Mycoplasma pneumoniae because these antibiotics target the cell wall.

;

;Generally speaking, macrolide antibacterial drugs, such as azithromycin and erythromycin, are currently the first-choice treatments for Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection. However, what makes many pediatricians troublesome is that the phenomenon of drug-resistant Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection is relatively common, which means that macrolide antibacterial drugs are not effective or even ineffective.

;

;The "Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Treatment of Mycoplasma Pneumonia in Children (2023 Edition)" released by the National Health Commission in February 2023 also pointed out that domestic restrictions on macrolides Antimicrobial drug-resistant infections are common and may be one of the main causes of severe mycoplasma pneumonia.

;

;"Drug-resistant mycoplasma infections are not new this year, they have been around for many years." Director Ding Guodong told Southern Weekend reporters that the children's respiratory tract where he works The ward mainly treats children with severe illness. Most of these children have been tested for drug-resistant genes. The results show that almost 90% are infected with drug-resistant mycoplasma.

;

;A paper published in the "Chinese Journal of Pathogen Biology" in 2023 pointed out that the detection rate of drug-resistant strains has become higher and higher in recent years. A Ningbo A regional study of Mycoplasma pneumoniae infections in hospitalized children from 2019 to 2021 showed that the drug resistance rate exceeded 70%.

;

;In this way, clinicians need to appropriately select second-line drugs based on the patient's condition and age, such as tetracycline antibiotics (doxycycline and minocycline) etc.) or quinolone drugs for anti-infective treatment, and at the same time, glucocorticoids are added to suppress the body's excessive immune inflammatory response and slow down the progression and severity of intrapulmonary and extrapulmonary complications.

;

;In addition, during the current seasonal transition period with large temperature changes, co-infection is also a huge challenge for children with poor immunity. Just two or three days ago, a child that Ding Guodong was checking in the ward was infected with drug-resistant Mycoplasma pneumoniae, influenza virus, and adenovirus at the same time. He suffered respiratory failure and was in a very critical condition. "Co-infection with multiple pathogens at the same time is generally worse than a single infection." Be serious."

;

;Therefore, Ding Guodong reminded that in addition to maintaining hygiene habits and doing daily protection, now is the time for influenza vaccination, and parents can take their children to get vaccinated in time. .

;

;When will the popularity end?

;

;Similar to the new coronavirus infection, after being infected with Mycoplasma pneumoniae and recovering, the antibody level in the body gradually decreases over time, and there is a possibility of reinfection.

;

;Qin Nannan’s son is 7 years old. This is not the first time he has been infected with Mycoplasma pneumoniae in 2023. He has already had it once before this epidemic season, so the family members I didn’t panic too much, I was quite aware of the child’s symptoms.

;

;On October 12, the Beijing Centers for Disease Control and Prevention posted on its official WeChat ID that Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection can occur throughout the year, with the highest incidence in Beijing from August to December every year. This is the high-incidence period for Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection, which generally reaches its peak around November every year.

;

;"Mycoplasma pneumoniae is an important pathogen of acute respiratory tract infections in Beijing. Mycoplasma pneumoniae is divided into two subtypes, type I and type II, which are currently mainly prevalent in Beijing. The subtype is type I." the article stated. At the same time, according to the weekly epidemic report released by the Beijing Center for Disease Control and Prevention on October 13, hand, foot and mouth disease was the infectious disease with the highest number of reported cases in the week of October 2-8.

;

;Mycoplasma pneumoniae is mainly spread through droplets, and the pathogen can be carried in secretions during coughing, sneezing, and runny noses. However, it is not a notifiable disease, so the local CDC does not necessarily monitor it.

;

;"The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported that Mycoplasma pneumoniae has spread in previous years, but it has not been included in the scope of monitoring for the time being, because what needs to be monitored is in accordance with policies. related infectious diseases." On October 17, Guangzhou health hotline staff responded to a reporter from Southern Weekend.

;

;A retrospective analysis published by the Shanghai Children's Hospital team in January 2023 showed that temperature, humidity, etc. in different regions may affect the prevalence of Mycoplasma pneumoniae. The peaks of Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection are different in the south and north of China. The incidence is high in winter in the north and in summer and autumn in the south.

;

;;(Qin Nannan is a pseudonym to protect patient privacy);
